title: Man Utd vs Lyon LIVE : Europa League latest score and confirmed lineups
body_text:
Harry Maguire’s scored a dramatic extra-winner as Manchester United secured a thrilling comeback win over Lyon to reach the Europa League semi-finals.
Tied at 2-2 after the first leg, United looked in cruise control after goals from Manuel Ugarte and Diogo Dalot put them two goals to the good at half-time.
But the visitors struck twice within the space of seven second-half minutes to level the tie and send the game to extra-time.
And despite going down to ten men after Corentin Tolisso’s sending off, Lyon went ahead when Rayan Cherki smashed an effort past Andre Onana on the brink of half-time in extra-time.
United then looked dead and buried shortly after the interval when Alexandre Lacazette converted from the spot to put Lyon 6-4 ahead on aggregate.
Instead, Ruben Amorim’s side bounced back immediately, Bruno Fernandes converting from the spot with six minutes remaining.
More Trending
And Kobbie Mainoo then looked like he had sent the game to penalties when the substitute found space inside the area to curl a wonderful effort into the far corner in the 120th minute.

But there was more drama in store just seconds later as Harry Maguire rose highest at the back post to head Casemiro’s cross into the far corner and complete a remarkable turnaround in front of a frenzied home crowd.
The scarcely believable comeback keeps United’s hopes of silverware and Champions League qualification alive and they will now face Athletic Bilbao in the semi-finals.

That’s all for now!
And with that, a superb midweek of European football comes to a close. Thanks for following along, and we’ll see you next time!
The semi-finals are set
So here is how we’re looking:
Tottenham vs Bodo/Glimt
Athletic Bilbao vs Manchester United
Could an all-English final be on the cards?
Ruben Amorim speaking to TNT Sports
‘I was watching the 1999 [Treble] documentary to have some inspiration for these moments. It was a great night, the team were tired, 4-2 with one more player, we think it’s over, but here it’s never over.
‘Here everything is possible, you feel the environment. At 4-3, after the Bruno Fernandes penalty, we felt we could change the game.”
‘We tried to put Harry Maguire up front because he is the only one who can score a goal with a header. Kobbie Mainoo has a lack of pace in this moment because of injury, but he’s really good in short spaces.’
Harry Maguire speaking to TNT Sports
‘Obviously it’s an incredible game, we made really hard work of it. We had full control in the second half, had chances to score a third, then they scored out of nowhere. It put us on the back foot.
‘To go down 4-2 in extra-time to 10 men is not good enough, we opened ourselves too much. But we dug in and showed great spirit, that’s what this stadium does.’
On his goal: ‘I felt like the fourth goal for them was a sucker punch but that we’d get chances to get back into it. It fell to myself and thankfully I scored, it was an amazing feeling.’
Celebrations at full-time
FULL-TIME: Man Utd 5-4 Lyon (7-6 agg.)
UNITED ARE THROUGH TO THE SEMI-FINALS!
Amorim’s side looked dead and buried in injury time but late goals from Mainoo and Maguire secure a scarcely believable 7-6 aggregate win for the hosts who progress to the semi-finals to keep their season alive.
And breathe…
Man Utd 5-4 Lyon (7-6 agg.)
120+7 mins: Into the eighth minute we go and we’re still playing. Fernandes goes down to win a free-kick – surely we’re near the end now?
Man Utd 5-4 Lyon (7-6 agg.)
120+3 mins: Five minutes of added time as Lyon now pour numbers forward looking for a winner. Mount wins a foul for United and the home side are surely going to run the clock down now.
GOAL! Man Utd 5-4 Lyon (Maguire, 120+1 mins)
AND UNITED HAVE SURELY WON IT! Maguire rises highest to head home Casemiro’s cross and it’s bedlam in the Old Trafford stands.
What a remarkable turnaround.
GOAL! Man Utd 4-4 Lyon (Mainoo, 120 mins)
HAVE YOU SEEN ANYTHING LIKE IT!
Mainoo brings it down superbly in the box, creates the opening and curls a wonderful effort past Perri to level things up!
What a tie.
Man Utd 3-4 Lyon (5-6 agg.)
118 mins: Fernandes on the edge of the box but it’s a poor effort from the skipper who slices it well wide of the mark.
Man Utd 3-4 Lyon (5-6 agg.)
116 mins: Appeals for another penalty as Maguire tumbles to the ground. The referee waves it away and there’s not much in that.
GOAL! Man Utd 3-4 Lyon (Fernandes, 114 mins)
Fernandes finds the back of the net! United surely can’t turn this around?
Man Utd 2-4 Lyon (4-6 agg.)
112 mins: PENALTY! United are appealing for a penalty now and the referee is heading over to the VAR monitor. It was Casemiro who went down in the box and the referee reverses his decision and awards the spot kick.
GOAL! Man Utd 2-4 Lyon (Lacazette, 110 mins)
And Lacazette makes no mistake! The Frenchman sends Onana the wrong way and fires into the bottom-left corner.
Four unanswered goals for the visitors who move 6-4 ahead on aggregate, playing with ten men. United need a miracle.
Man Utd 2-3 Lyon (4-5 agg.)
108 mins: PENALTY! From bad to worse for United as Shaw brings down Fofana inside the area.
Lyon with a chance to surely put this game to bed.
Man Utd 2-3 Lyon (4-5 agg.)
107 mins: A change for the visitors as Abner comes on for Cherki. A defensive switch from the visitors.
United, meanwhile, have thrown Maguire forward as a makeshift striker as they go in search of an equaliser to send us to penalties.
Man Utd 2-3 Lyon (4-5 agg.)
106 mins: And we’re back underway. 15 minutes for United to save their season.
HALF-TIME: Man Utd 2-3 Lyon (4-5 agg.)
Added time in extra-time flies by and United are suddenly staring an exit square in the face.
A smattering of boos ring out from the Old Trafford crowd – they must be stunned by what they have witnessed after that superb first-half display.
GOAL! Man Utd 2-3 Lyon (Cherki, 105 mins)
WOW, WOW, WOW! Ten-man Lyon hit the front!
Fofana’s mazy run draws in two United players but the loose ball falls to Cherki who smashes it past Onana to give Lyon a 5-4 lead on aggregate on the brink of half-time in extra-time.,
